DOC.brief_summary: Increased mammographic density recognize important risk factor develop breast cancer , however , underlie mechanism explain relationship unclear . The investigator hypothesize Molecular Breast Imaging ( MBI ) accurately distinguish dense tissue mammography high risk dense tissue low risk indicate cellular activity dense tissue radiotracer uptake ( functional density ) breast . In pilot study , investigator want compare histological characteristic breast tissue patient similar density mammography different level functional density MBI .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Age 40 old 2 . Be postmenopausal define least 12 consecutive month amenorrhea 3 . Screening mammogram perform Mayo Clinic Rochester within one year prior current MBI study demonstrate 1 . Negative benign assessment ( BIRADs category 12 ) 2 . No proliferative benign lesion ( e.g . fibroadenoma ) identify 3 . Heterogeneously dense extremely dense parenchyma ( BIRADs density category 3 4 ) 4 . MBI perform less one month prior biopsy demonstrate either significant FD photopenic FD . Exclusion criterion : 1 . Using exogenous hormone ( e.g. , hormonal contraceptive , sex steroid hormone ) estrogen receptor modulating drug ( e.g. , tamoxifen , raloxifene ) aromatase inhibitor within six month prior study biopsy . 2 . Personal history cancer , except nonmelanomatous skin cancer 3 . Current breast symptom 4 . Breast implant 5 . Known allergy local anesthetic . 6 . History bleed complication prior intervention 7 . Current use anticoagulant ( e.g. , Coumadin blood thinner ) 8 . Major medical condition
